definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
to fall flat on one's face
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
(coll.) to live with and depend on one's parents even upon reaching adulthood
(coll.) adults still living with and depending on their parents

sentences.english: The egoism of an artist sometimes seems natural.
sentences.chinese: 艺术家的自负有时啃垧来是自然的。

sentences.english: But he could only nibble two steamed buns of broomcorn flour at each meal.
sentences.chinese: 可是他每顿饭只能啃两个高粱面馍。

sentences.english: I saw some sheep knapping the grass.
Shift not yourself in the sight of others, nor gnaw your nails.
sentences.chinese: 不要在别人的视野里晃来晃去，也不要啃手指甲。

sentences.english: Pets may also gnaw on electrical cords for Christmas-tree lights.
sentences.chinese: 宠物也会因啃咬彩灯的电线而触电。
九个敏捷的贵族啃桃仁。

sentences.english: And, of course, there were scraps for Vladimir and a bone for Bayan.
sentences.chinese: 当然，弗拉迪米尔也有碎面包吃，巴延还有根骨头啃。

sentences.english: He spent the whole evening swotting at English.
sentences.chinese: 他整晚上都在啃英语书。

sentences.english: He only drank a cup of black tea and nibbled at a piece of dry bread for his supper.
sentences.chinese: 他在晚餐上只喝了一杯红茶，啃了一片干面包。

sentences.english: The cat picked the meat from the bone.
China is a difficult place for foreign retailers, however.
sentences.chinese: 不过，中国对外国零售商来说是块难啃的“硬骨头”。

sentences.english: Sleeping sickness is spread by the bite of the tsetse fly.
sentences.chinese: 昏睡症由孑孓蝇的啃咬传播。

sentences.english: The dog has been gnawing away on the bone all day.
sentences.chinese: 这条狗整天一直在啃一块骨头。

sentences.english: The puppy chewed a hole in the slipper.
sentences.chinese: 小狗在拖鞋上啃了一个洞。

sentences.english: Chewing on wood, can progress to the more serious condition of cribbing and wind sucking.
sentences.chinese: 啃木头的行为可能发展成更严重的咬槽癖和咽气癖。

sentences.english: The fish are nibbling (at) my toes.

definition: to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
to hold with one's mouth (as a smoker with a cigarette or a dog with a bone)
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
carpenter's plane/to plane (woodwork)/to shave off/to peel (with a potato peeler etc)
to dig/to excavate/(coll.) to exclude/not to count/to deduct/to subtract
